story:
We did it! We exceeded our goal of $5000.  

Because of the success of the campaign we will be shutting it down today, May 15. Thank you, genuinely, for your support. Together we have made this commission a reality. 

What is Leftovers?

Leftovers is a one-person comic monologue about a life spent on the left in the political/economic age of neo-liberalism. That one person is Charlie Demers.

Charlie is a socialist who was born in 1980, the year Ronald Reagan was elected president of the United States. In Charlie’s words, “1980 was the Left’s equivalent of the Mayan calendar’s 2012.” It is the worst imaginable period in recent western history to identify as a socialist, a three-decade span in which neo-liberal orthodoxy and global capital have become dominant ideological and political forces across the world.  If it’s true that over the last 30 years the wealthiest 1% have accumulated more wealth than in any other time in history, why does it feel impossible for us to imagine anything else? And he’s going to make us laugh. Yep. Likely a lot. That’s Leftovers, and that’s Charlie Demers.

What is a Community Commission?

This community commission is an invitation to join us.

Last year, the City of Vancouver suspended its local residency/commissioning program. And so we’re looking to those in our community for help. We're asking those we believe share our values and our desire to challenge the systems we don’t believe to stand together with us and help make Leftovers happen. We are asking our community to join Neworld Theatre in commissioning it. Shows can’t get made if people like Charlie don’t have time to write them. Dissent can’t be expressed if communities aren’t willing to stand up and invest in what they believe. We believe that our culture -- what we choose to say together – is more valuable and more meaningful than the things we are told over and over again by the mass media. We think that’s important. And we hope you will, too.

What will my Contribution do?

Your contribution will help us create time and space for Charlie to write the show. We are asking you, quite literally, to commission Charlie along with Neworld Theatre.  In doing so you will become an integral part of the process. 

The Premiere

Leftovers will premiere locally at the Shadbolt Center for the Arts in March 2015, and will tour after that. Everyone who contributes to this campaign will be a part of that premiere.

We also see a tremendous potential for audience crossover between the more traditional theatre touring network that Neworld is connected to and the comedy circuit that Charlie is a part of. This is a kind of crossover that never happens. Together we are able to reach a far bigger audience than we would have been able to on our own.

It’s inarguably true that over the last 30 years the globe’s wealthiest class has accumulated more wealth than in any other time in modern history. A contribution to this campaign won’t change the world. But it might help us begin the process of imagining something else.

And laugh while we do it.

That’s something we can get behind. We hope you will, too.

Our Team

Charlie Demers - Leftovers Writer and Performer

Charlie Demers is a Vancouver comedian, humourist and author, heralded by CBC Radio as ''truly one of the smartest comics out there.'' In addition to having performed in clubs and at festivals across the country, and as a regular guest on CBC's The Debaters and This is That, he is the author of the books The Prescription Errors and Vancouver Special, which was a finalist for the BC Bookprize for non-fiction. He is a former co-host of The Citynews List, a nightly comedy television newspanel show, and has written and performed comedy for TV, radio, web and the stage, including the "shamelessly funny" Jack & the Beanstalk: An East Van Panto, "with plenty of big laughs for little kids and their big-kid parents as well," according to The Province.

Marcus Youssef – Neworld Theatre Artistic Director, Leftovers Director

The ethic and practice of collaboration are central to Marcus’ creative work. His plays, many of which were written or created with friends and colleagues, include: Winners and Losers, Jabber, How Has My Love Affected You?, Ali and Ali and the aXes of Evil and Ali & Ali: The Deportation Hearings, Everyone, Adrift, 3299: Forms in Order, Peter Panties and A Line in the Sand. They have been presented across North America, Australia and Europe, translated into Czech, Flemish, and Italian, and published by Talonbooks and Playwrights Canada Press. Awards: Rio-Tinto Alcan Performing Arts, Chalmer’s Canadian Play, Arts Club Silver Commission, Seattle Times Footlight, Vancouver Sun Critics’ Choice Innovation (three times), as well as numerous Jessies (Vancouver), Masques (Montreal) and Doras (Toronto). He lives in Vancouver’s Commercial Drive area with his partner, teacher Amanda Fritzlan, and their sons Oscar and Zak.

We will issue tax receipts for any donation above $20.
story_txt:
We did it! We exceeded our goal of $5000.  Because of the success of the campaign we will be shutting it down today, May 15. Thank you, genuinely, for your support. Together we have made this commission a reality. What is Leftovers?
Leftovers is a one-person comic monologue about a
life spent on the left in the political/economic age of neo-liberalism. That
one person is Charlie Demers. 
Charlie is a
socialist who was born in 1980, the year Ronald Reagan was elected president of
the United States. In Charlie’s words, “1980 was the Left’s equivalent of the
Mayan calendar’s 2012.” It is the worst imaginable period in recent western
history to identify as a socialist, a three-decade span in which neo-liberal
orthodoxy and global capital have become dominant ideological and political
forces across the world.  If it’s true that over the last 30 years the wealthiest 1% have accumulated more wealth than in any other time in history, why does it feel
impossible for us to imagine anything else? And he’s going to make us laugh.
Yep. Likely a lot. That’s Leftovers,
and that’s Charlie Demers. 

What is a Community Commission?
This community
commission is an invitation to join us. 
Last year, the City of Vancouver suspended its local residency/commissioning program. And so we’re looking to those in our community for help. We're asking those we believe share our values and our desire to challenge the systems we don’t believe to stand together with us and help make Leftovers happen. We are asking our community to join Neworld Theatre in commissioning it. Shows can’t get made if people like Charlie don’t have time to write them. Dissent can’t be expressed if communities aren’t willing to stand up and invest in what they believe. We believe that our culture -- what we choose to say together – is more valuable and more meaningful than the things we are told over and over again by the mass media. We think that’s important. And we hope you will, too. 
What will my Contribution do?
Your
contribution will help us create time and space for Charlie to write the show.
We are asking you, quite literally, to commission Charlie along with Neworld
Theatre.  In doing so you will become an integral part of the process.  

The Premiere
Leftovers will premiere locally at the Shadbolt Center
for the Arts in March 2015, and will tour after that. Everyone who contributes
to this campaign will be a part of that premiere. 
We also see a
tremendous potential for audience crossover between the more traditional
theatre touring network that Neworld is connected to and the comedy circuit
that Charlie is a part of. This is a kind of crossover that never happens.
Together we are able to reach a far bigger audience than we would have been
able to on our own. 
It’s inarguably
true that over the last 30 years the globe’s wealthiest class has accumulated
more wealth than in any other time in modern history. A contribution to this
campaign won’t change the world. But it might help us begin the process of
imagining something else. 
And laugh while
we do it. 
That’s something
we can get behind. We hope you will, too. 
Our Team
Charlie Demers - Leftovers Writer and Performer
Charlie Demers
is a Vancouver comedian, humourist and author, heralded by CBC Radio as ''truly
one of the smartest comics out there.'' In addition to having performed in
clubs and at festivals across the country, and as a regular guest on CBC's
The Debaters and This is That, he is the author of the
books The Prescription Errors and Vancouver Special,
which was a finalist for the BC Bookprize for non-fiction. He is a former
co-host of The Citynews List, a nightly comedy television newspanel
show, and has written and performed comedy for TV, radio, web and the stage,
including the "shamelessly funny" Jack & the Beanstalk:
An East Van Panto, "with plenty of big laughs for little kids and
their big-kid parents as well," according to The Province.
Marcus Youssef – Neworld Theatre Artistic
Director, Leftovers Director

The ethic and practice of
collaboration are central to Marcus’ creative work. His plays, many of which
were written or created with friends and colleagues, include: Winners
and Losers, Jabber, How
Has My Love Affected You?, Ali and
Ali and the aXes of Evil and Ali & Ali: The Deportation Hearings, Everyone, Adrift, 3299: Forms in
Order, Peter Panties and A Line in the Sand. They have been
presented across North America, Australia and Europe, translated into Czech,
Flemish, and Italian, and published by Talonbooks and Playwrights Canada Press.
Awards: Rio-Tinto Alcan Performing Arts, Chalmer’s Canadian Play, Arts Club
Silver Commission, Seattle Times Footlight, Vancouver Sun Critics’ Choice
Innovation (three times), as well as numerous Jessies (Vancouver), Masques
(Montreal) and Doras (Toronto). He lives in Vancouver’s Commercial Drive area
with his partner, teacher Amanda Fritzlan, and their sons Oscar and Zak.

We will issue tax receipts for any donation above $20.

story:
Help Us Bring Back a Critically Acclaimed Hit

If you missed it the first time...
Noel Coward's THE VORTEX is  back!  Beginning November 13th, Nicky and Florence, friends and frenemies will set up their cocktail trolley and move into the prestigious Matrix Theatre in West Hollywood in the heart of Melrose Avenue.

This rarely produced masterpiece played last Spring at Malibu Playhouse  and was a critical darling.  Directed by Gene Franklin Smith and updated to the swinging 1960's, the show nabbed some fantastic reviews: 

"Sensational powerhouse performances!" - Stage Scene LA

"A smashing success - brilliantly acted and directed!"  - FVM Global Magazine

"Powerful - impressive - outstanding!" - Malibu Surfside News

"Sprightly paced - enjoyable new production - a strong cast!" - Stage Raw

"Bravura performances - superb cast!"  - The Anglo Files

Tell Me More About THE VORTEX!

THE VORTEX was Noel Coward's first hit play, premiering in 1924, and due to its "scandalous" subject matter, Coward was propelled to international stardom overnight.

Updated to Mod London of 1965, Nicky Lancaster brings his elegant fiancée, Bunty, home to introduce her to his famous mother, stage actress Florence Lancaster. Nicky is shocked to discover that Florence has taken a much-younger lover, and when Bunty ditches Nicky to run off with Florence’s boy-toy, both are forced to confront the truth about themselves.

Presented by Amanda Eliasch and Vespa Collaborative, the Matrix Theatre production stars the original stars of the Malibu Playhouse production, Shannon Holt (multi-award nominated and winner, including the 2014 Scenie Award Best Actress in a Comedy/Drama) as "Florence" and Craig Robert Young (2014 Scenie Award Best Actor in a Comedy/Drama) as "Nicky"  and features other original cast members: Victoria Hoffman ("Helen"), Daniel Jimenez ("Tom"), Skye LaFontaine ("Bunty") and Cameron Mitchell Jr, ("Pawnie") and new-comer to the show, John Mawson ("David").
THE VORTEX opens November 13, 2014 and plays Thursdays through Sundays until December 14 at the Matrix Theatre, 7657 Melrose Avenue, Los Angeles.
  • Directed by Gene Franklin Smith 
  • Set Design by Erin Walley (2014 Scenie Award Best Scenic Designer)
  • Lighting Design by Leigh Allen (2014 Scenie Award Best Lighting Designer)
  • Costume Design by Shon LeBlanc (2014 Scenie Award Best Costume Designer)
  • Sound Design by Joe Calarco
  • Wig and Makeup Design by Dale Johnson
  • Choreography by Anna Safar

Multi-award-winning Costume Designer Shon LeBlanc shares his vision for designing The Vortex.

How Your Money Will Be Spent

Here's a good look at the costs for producing THE VORTEX at the Matrix Theatre:

You'll see that the theatre rental is a big chunk of our budget. The Matrix is definitely worth the investment. It is a premiere 99-seat theatre in the heart of Melrose Avenue, surrounded by trendy shops and excellent restaurants, all within walking distance.
Although our total budget is anticipated at more than this campaign's goal, we will be completing our fundraising at an exclusive party on Sunset Strip at Vaucluse Lounge (which also happens to be one of the perks)!

How Does Indiegogo Work?

It's really quite simple.  We're offering fabulous perks for every level of donation, starting for as little as $10.  Choose your donation and perk, supply some basic information, then check out securely (we use Pay Pal) in a snap.

Every penny you donate will be directly allocated to the production -- and you can make a pledge from anywhere in the world!  

Challenges

Producing theater in Los Angeles is always a daunting prospect because there is so much work being produced all at once.  The play needs to be good -- really good -- to succeed in attracting audiences.

THE VORTEX is a project of passion for all of us involved.  It's riotously clever but also deeply personal and emotionally moving.  After every performance at Malibu Playhouse, parents who were estranged from their children (and vice versa) told us that they were so affected by the play that they would reach out to their son/daughter just to say "I love you."

Our production opens at the beginning of the holiday season, and we'll be bringing lots of Christmas cheer (and hot toddies, darling) to you and yours.

We hope you'll come share the laughter and shed a tear (maybe two) with us. But if you live too far away, you can still help us reach our goal by donating here!

Pre-Pay for Your VIP Ticket

If you're unable to contribute just now, but would still love to show your support, you can pre-pay for your VIP ticket to any show (excluding opening and closing nights), and we'll throw in a specialty cocktail with the price of admission. 
You can buy your ticket here for only $25 before they go on sale at $34.

Share Our Campaign 

You can also help by sharing our campaign via social media and email to friends and family and anyone you know who loves quality theatre.

Our production opens at the beginning of the holiday season, and we'll be bringing lots of Christmas cheer (and hot toddies, darling) to you and yours.
We hope you'll come share the laughter and shed a tear (maybe two) with us. But if you live too far away, you can still help us reach our goal by donating here!

If you're unable to contribute just now, but would still love to show your support, you can pre-pay for your VIP ticket to any show (excluding opening and closing nights), and we'll throw in a specialty cocktail with the price of admission. 
You can buy your ticket here for only $25 before they go on sale at $34.

Share Our Campaign You can also help by sharing our campaign via social media and email to friends and family and anyone you know who loves quality theatre.

story:
$1000 Milestone!!!


What We're Doing

Ale House Theatre Co. is proud to be bringing The Tragedie of Othello, the Moore of Venice to Toronto this Spring and, because of the amazing support we received on our last campaign, we're reaching out to this incredible community to help make our most ambitious undertaking to date a reality! 

This is our largest production ever – by a lot. Months of planning, an expanded crew, inspired designers, the recruitment of brilliant and passionate actors, six weeks of rehearsal, a million emails a day, a doubled budget, and endless to-do lists are all culminating in what will be a production unlike any in Toronto.

Othello is a heart wrenching story that brutally explores friendship and betrayal, ambition and honesty. It will keep you aching on the edge of your seat as consequences spiral out of control. Balanced with moments of joy, love, passion, and filled with humour and innocence, this tragedy is not to be missed!

So why is it so often overlooked in Toronto and elsewhere? 

What We Need!

One of the most exciting aspects of our production is the theatre we are creating. We have a beautiful design and our Master builder lined up, but we need to cover the costs of building materials and tools as well as compensating our builder and designer for their hard work and vision.

This is what we want most for you: a beautiful, intimate, classical stage. A structure from which our players can help you laugh through the saddest story ever told. Check out the Adopt-a-Stage perk for a rotating list of sections of the stage to contribute to. Your name will be added to the image above as proof!

Also important are costumes! Our Master of Wardrobe has put together a dream collection of costumes that will help transport our actors and audience to a time not unlike our own.



Your Impact

Your contribution turns the impossible upside down. It can allow us to fully realize the set and costumes mentioned above, along with the many props that are needed, and it all brings us closer to being able to properly compensate these artists for their passion and hard work. 

Most important, you are helping us bring The Tragedie of Othello, the Moore of Venice to Toronto!

In exchange for your generosity, we are offering a new and expanded set of perks! Take a look.

Who Are We?

Ale House began in 2012 as a small company testing the limits of our actors and audience with full and uncut productions of Shakespeare. Since then we have produced three successful productions as well as a free public reading of Shakespeare's lost play, Edmund Ironside. As we move into our largest production ever, we remain confident in our belief that Shakespeare has more to offer the 21st century than we can imagine. The key lies in the skill of the actor and an absolute faith in Toronto's theatre-going audience. To foster this relationship our productions are inspired by the theatre practices of Shakespeare's own day: a time when a small group of actors used language and movement to  captivate thousands of rowdy patrons every single day.

For a look at our past shows check out:
http://alehousetheatre.com/

And check out our last campaign here!
http://igg.me/at/alehousetheatre

Cast & Crew

Anthony Sherwood as Othello
Tayves Fiddis as Iago
Hilary McCormack as Desdemona
Andrea Brown as Emilia
Patric Masurkevitch as Brabantio and Lodovico
Alex Coté as Cassio
Chris Whidden as Roderigo
Paul Bryan as Montano and the Duke
Isabel Kanaan as Bianca

Lin Lay – Stage Manager
Alejandra Galindo – Master of Costume
Danny Tran – Master of Props
Chelsea McBride – Master of Music
Jacqueline Costa – Master of the Stage
Todd Campbell – Master of Combat
Chris McCormack – Master Builder
Matt Crans – Master of Art
Taylor Gyenge – Master of Marketing
Elysia White, Jordan Campbell, Hilary McCormack – Outreach

Directed by Joshua Stodart

Produced by Joshua Stodart, Tayves Fiddis, and Andrew Anthony

story:
Connolly & Co. 

Connolly & Co. is an emerging dance company led by Lauren Connolly, a choreographer and dance educator from New Jersey. We are invested in how dance can initiate physical, intellectual, emotional and spatial transformations. Based on a vocabulary of athleticism and an exploration of the virtuosic human body, we aim to embrace the unknown territory of humanity and social behaviors while creating work that is engaging and accessible to all audiences. 

We are launching our campaign because we need your help in supporting all of the artists and collaborators involved in our current and upcoming projects. Laying the foundation for a new dance company can be strenuous and financially taxing because of the cost of the artistic and production elements. 

What We Need 

This past Spring we were chosen to participate in Jersey (New) Moves! at NJPAC and The Koresh Dance Company Come Together Dance Festival in Philadelphia.  

10 Dancers. 2 Major Projects. 1 Year of Upcoming Projects 

Your contribution and participation will provide us with the resources to succeed. Your funds will produce high caliber works, provide original costumes, cover travel expenses, submission fees, overnight accommodations, and build a future for upcoming projects. Most importantly, it will compensate the dancers and collaborators for their time, labor and artistry. 

The majority of the contributions made to our campaign will go to the dancers and collaborators for their endless devotion, patience and dedication. It is rewarding to work with dancers who embrace the unknown and have trust in the overall journey of the work.  

The Impact

With your donation, you will not only impact a community of people, but you will have a hand in the mission to redefine dance.

This has been a big year for Connolly & Co. We are excited and honored to be part of Jersey (New) Moves! at NJPAC and the Koresh Come Together Dance Festival at the Suzanne Roberts Theatre in Philadelphia. We want to continue making work that bridges audiences and different communities together and we need your financial contributions and support to turn that into a reality.  

Taking a Risk and Other Ways You Can Help

Making art is a risk. As artists, we take those risks because we ultimately believe in the power of movement. 

Any contribution will make the biggest difference! If you cannot donate, you can still help us by reaching new audiences:

  • Spread the word by sharing our campaign with anyone who would be interested in our mission on Facebook, Instagram, Indiegogo and other social media outlets. 
  • Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/connollyco 
  • Follow us on Instagram: https://instagram.com/connco15 
  • Come to the shows and join in the performance experience with us! 

Thank you for your time, consideration and support to bring Connolly & Co. to stage!

story:
Theater On Tap is a new theater company based in Fitchburg, MA that is being organized by people with the same mentality of those that said: "Let's send a dog into space. That might be cool."

Our Story

When Russia sent their dog Laika into the atmosphere, it probably cost them millions of dollars. To send our metaphorical dog (good theater) into metaphorical space (Fitchburg), we’re only asking for $1,000. We are a collection of three artistic individuals who are hoping to bring a fresh take on theater into our area. How fresh? Bel-Air fresh. We want every show to be something special. We don’t want to give too much away, but just imagine with me for a second...you walk into see a show and suddenly, there's live music, social media integrations, and a fun atmosphere. You’ll find it all and more at Theater On Tap. Most importantly, it is our mission to inspire the community by providing artistic entertainment and opportunities. We will strive to challenge as well as engage artists and audiences alike with a take on theater that is financially accessible and welcoming to all.

Here's Where You Come In...

With every new endeavor, a base fund is needed to get the project off the ground. It is our hope that once we secure this initial amount, we’ll never have to ask for crowdfunded money again. Each play we plan to produce comes with a royalty that amounts to roughly $75 per performance. In our first season, we plan to perform each show 6 times. That adds up to $450 just for one show alone. Here’s a list of everything else that we need the money for: the other two shows royalties, venue costs, insurance, sets, costumes, intermission refreshments to feed you, and further artistic ventures down the line. That sure is a lot of stuff that we don't have the money for.

But here’s the good news: when you donate and we suddenly have money, we have a whopping THREE perks available to you. There's the high five, or the On Tap Exclusive, or you have the opportunity to be "the coolest." That's three options. Just like we promised. We don’t joke around when it comes to perks. You can find all these options and what they entail to the right of the page. 

Challenges and The Impact

As you can probably imagine, starting a theater company from scratch is hard to do. But we've set the foundation and now we're nearing the finish line! The money we receive will not only go towards our start-up, but also to our future. Once we get started, it will be constant work to keep going. This isn't a a one time thing, it is our goal to keep Theater On Tap running beyond this first season. That will require owning our own venue, paying actors and directors, but we don't wish to bore you with the abundance of things that will have to be taken care of. Instead, know that every penny that we don't use during this start-up period will go towards the challenges that lie ahead. If you're interested in the future of this company, here is a brief look at our overall vision:

  • Provide artistically excellent entertainment and entice diverse audiences by presenting them with engaging work.

  • Foster the creative and artistic nature of children by creating youth programs that help make theater an active part of their lives. 

  • A guarantee to artists that we will uphold and maintain a high standard professional working environment and give them well-deserved appreciation

  • Encourage collaborations with various organizations and people, including multiple potential in-residence programs (actors, playwrights, etc.).

  • Serve as professional extension of Fitchburg State University's award winning theater program. Allow young artists to get more experience on their resume and provide the same quality work as that of the University's MainStage offerings.

Meet The Team

Theater On Tap was founded and is being run by young professionals who have already had much experience with theater.

Noah Dawson is not only a co-founder of Theater On Tap, but he also serves as the Artistic Director. He's a simple guy, one who enjoys the finer things in life, like Vanilla Chai. Noah just graduated from Fitchburg State University, receiving a BS in Communications Media with a concentration in Theatre. He acts (just completed a tour with the longest continually running children's theatre tour), directs (he's in production for The Odd Couple at a local college right now), and writes (he once won a competition in Playwrighting class). This guy's got it. Whatever "it" is.

Mary Darling is a co-founder of Theater On Tap and serves as Managing Director. She likes to be called chief around the office. Mary is finishing up her last semester of college with a killer internship in Boston. She will soon be graduating with a BS in Communications Media with concentrations in Theatre and Professional Communication from Fitchburg State University. Aside from acting and directing, she is an aspiring playwright. Maybe one day, you'll pick up one of her plays at the library, judge it by it's cover, and put it back in the wrong spot. 

Matt Lewis is not a co-founder of Theater On Tap, but he is the Company Manager. He has an Associates in both Theatre and Business from Northern Essex Community College and is now furthering his education at Fitchburg State University. He's done everything there is to do when it comes to theater, but prefers to work tech over acting. This is why we keep him around. In order to fund his lavish lifestyle, Matt has taken to many different jobs. A dish washer. A baker. What hasn't he done? We don't know. He truly is a jack of all trades. 

There you have it. We need not say more. These guys have plenty of experience with theater and are surely qualified for the job of running a company on their own. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We are being faced with many varying expenses that we alone cannot weather, but with your help, Theater on Tap can be a reality.  Our professional team of committed persons is ready and willing to craft a theater experience unlike any other.  We hope that we have peaked your interest in the company and that you want to see it succeed as much as we do.  If you like us as much as we would probably like you, please spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your friends. Please shoot us an e-mail (theaterontap@gmail.com) if you have any questions/comments about the campaign, the perks, the company, or anything else. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you for taking the time to read all about us and thank you, in advance, for the donation. We'll see you at the shows!
story_txt:
Theater On Tap is a new theater company based in Fitchburg, MA that is being organized by people with the same mentality of those that said: "Let's send a dog into space. That might be cool."
Our Story

When Russia sent their dog Laika into the atmosphere, it probably cost them millions of dollars. To send our metaphorical dog (good theater) into metaphorical space (Fitchburg), we’re only asking for $1,000. We are a collection of three artistic individuals who are hoping to bring a fresh take on theater into our area. How fresh? Bel-Air fresh. We want every show to be something special. We don’t want to give too much away, but just imagine with me for a second...you walk into see a show and suddenly, there's live music, social media integrations, and a fun atmosphere. You’ll find it all and more at Theater On Tap. Most importantly, it is our mission to inspire the community by providing artistic entertainment and opportunities. We will strive to challenge as well as engage artists and audiences alike with a take on theater that is financially accessible and welcoming to all.



Here's Where You Come In...

With every new endeavor, a base fund is needed to get the project off the ground. It is our hope that once we secure this initial amount, we’ll never have to ask for crowdfunded money again. Each play we plan to produce comes with a royalty that amounts to roughly $75 per performance. In our first season, we plan to perform each show 6 times. That adds up to $450 just for one show alone. Here’s a list of everything else that we need the money for: the other two shows royalties, venue costs, insurance, sets, costumes, intermission refreshments to feed you, and further artistic ventures down the line. That sure is a lot of stuff that we don't have the money for.
But here’s the good news: when you donate and we suddenly have money, we have a whopping THREE perks available to you. There's the high five, or the On Tap Exclusive, or you have the opportunity to be "the coolest." That's three options. Just like we promised. We don’t joke around when it comes to perks. You can find all these options and what they entail to the right of the page. 
Challenges and The Impact

As you can probably imagine, starting a theater company from scratch is hard to do. But we've set the foundation and now we're nearing the finish line! The money we receive will not only go towards our start-up, but also to our future. Once we get started, it will be constant work to keep going. This isn't a a one time thing, it is our goal to keep Theater On Tap running beyond this first season. That will require owning our own venue, paying actors and directors, but we don't wish to bore you with the abundance of things that will have to be taken care of. Instead, know that every penny that we don't use during this start-up period will go towards the challenges that lie ahead. If you're interested in the future of this company, here is a brief look at our overall vision:

Provide artistically excellent entertainment and entice diverse audiences by presenting them with engaging work.

Foster the creative and artistic nature of children by creating youth programs that help make theater an active part of their lives. 
A guarantee to artists that we will uphold and maintain a high standard professional working environment and give them well-deserved appreciation
Encourage collaborations with various organizations and people, including multiple potential in-residence programs (actors, playwrights, etc.).
Serve as professional extension of Fitchburg State University's award winning theater program. Allow young artists to get more experience on their resume and provide the same quality work as that of the University's MainStage offerings.


Meet The Team
Theater On Tap was founded and is being run by young professionals who have already had much experience with theater.
Noah Dawson is not only a co-founder of Theater On Tap, but he also serves as the Artistic Director. He's a simple guy, one who enjoys the finer things in life, like Vanilla Chai. Noah just graduated from Fitchburg State University, receiving a BS in Communications Media with a concentration in Theatre. He acts (just completed a tour with the longest continually running children's theatre tour), directs (he's in production for The Odd Couple at a local college right now), and writes (he once won a competition in Playwrighting class). This guy's got it. Whatever "it" is.
Mary Darling is a co-founder of Theater On Tap and serves as Managing Director. She likes to be called chief around the office. Mary is finishing up her last semester of college with a killer internship in Boston. She will soon be graduating with a BS in Communications Media with concentrations in Theatre and Professional Communication from Fitchburg State University. Aside from acting and directing, she is an aspiring playwright. Maybe one day, you'll pick up one of her plays at the library, judge it by it's cover, and put it back in the wrong spot. 
Matt Lewis is not a co-founder of Theater On Tap, but he is the Company Manager. He has an Associates in both Theatre and Business from Northern Essex Community College and is now furthering his education at Fitchburg State University. He's done everything there is to do when it comes to theater, but prefers to work tech over acting. This is why we keep him around. In order to fund his lavish lifestyle, Matt has taken to many different jobs. A dish washer. A baker. What hasn't he done? We don't know. He truly is a jack of all trades. 
There you have it. We need not say more. These guys have plenty of experience with theater and are surely qualified for the job of running a company on their own. 

  Other Ways You Can Help 
 We are being faced with many varying expenses that we alone cannot weather, but with your help, Theater on Tap can be a reality.  Our professional team of committed persons is ready and willing to craft a theater experience unlike any other.  We hope that we have peaked your interest in the company and that you want to see it succeed as much as we do.  If you like us as much as we would probably like you, please spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your friends. Please shoot us an e-mail (theaterontap@gmail.com) if you have any questions/comments about the campaign, the perks, the company, or anything else. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you for taking the time to read all about us and thank you, in advance, for the donation. We'll see you at the shows!

story:
• Thank you for viewing our appeal for RadioSOUL! The MUSICAL.  Through this limited campaign, we are looking to raise a minimum of $30,000 in order to supplement a series of STAGED SHOWCASES to help us secure funding and backers in order to make a full-run possible. 

The proceeds from the funding of the SHOWCASE will help us take care of:

  1. Minimal payments to cast and crew.   Please note that as RadioSOUL! has been developed, we have been quite fortunate to attract and secure veteran talent, both in front of and behind the curtain. These people BELIEVE IN the artistry and mission of RadioSOUL! The Musical to the extent that they are willing to make necessary sacrifices in order to see the project mature to its full potential.  As a result, we have secured a 35-year veteran General Manager, a Broadway Director,  an award winning Musical Director, Choreographer, Technical Director and a Scenic Design chief to lead the respective teams. 
  2. Completion of the musical score.   RadioSOUL! is a full-length musical that has wall-to-wall Original Music that echoes the songs marking the heyday of the Soul Music Era.  From R&B to ballads, inspirational to instrumentals, "funk" to the beginnings of "hip-hop", RadioSOUL! The Musical illustrates just how we got from "there to here" as Soul Radio and recording industry evolved to the digital age.  
 

Your Contribution will allow a very important story to be told regarding the importance of Black Radio at a critical time in America's development. And with your help, RadioSOUL! The MUSICAL will serve as a living legacy to it's importance and contribution to our collective social and political culture.

story:
Omi Mahina Tribal Fusion Dance



Omi Mahina has been fortunate to be affiliated with Blacktop Comedy in Roseville, CA.  Blacktop has had the wonderful opportunity to grow and we are moving with them in November 2014.  We are very excited for the new, larger space but really need some help purchasing enough mirrors for the new space.

In our new space, we will be occasionally sharing the room with a children’s program and we want to purchase unbreakable portable mirror panels as they will be a safer option than more traditional wall mounted mirrors.  Portable mirrors will also allow us to host larger workshops and guest teachers in the theater space. 

Omi Mahina is the labor of love of Talia and Malolo.  We teach because we truly believe dance and all of its benefits should be accessible to every woman at each stage in her life.  We believe that tribal fusion dance has countless benefits to body mind and spirit and love the sense of art and community that dancing together brings.  

The Blacktop Studio Space is also open for sublease to the community-so these mirrors would also be available for other people to use at their events and workshops.  

Any contribution amount helps us defray the cost of our mirrors.  Please share this campaign on your Facebook page and with your friends.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Aries In Flight’s choreography evokes the styles of past Theater Jazz icons and merges them with a contemporary flair. The dance company aims to legitimize Theater Jazz as a valuable player in the concert dance world and educate both our audiences and the dance community in this historically rich tradition, delighting them with show-stopping repertoire. Our long-term vision is to strengthen future generations of Theater Jazz dancers through dance classes, educational programming in historical knowledge, performance opportunities, and collaborations within the dance community.

One of the ways in which I intend to carry out this mission is by performing in showcases throughout the NYC metropolitan area. Aries In Flight will be performing our signature piece along with a new work at the upcoming Artists In Flight Performance Showcase this fall. This performance will require rehearsal fees, dancer fees, and costume costs. Today I am reaching out to ask you to consider making a donation to this project. With your support we will be able to fully participate in this performance opportunity and bring our mission further into the dance community. We are at a pivotal stage in this project and your contribution is essential to our success at this time. The performance will take place on November 12 at West Park Presbyterian on the upper west side of Manhattan. There will be 2 performances, a 4pm show and a 7pm show. This showcase will be covered by Broadway World reviewers and dance industry professionals who will enable Aries In Flight to reach a broader audience. All monies raised will be used to pay the $300 in rehearsal rental space, $800 in dancer stipends/expenses, and $100 in costume costs . We will not be able to participate in this prestigious NYC showcase without YOUR help. Our fundraising deadline is Friday November 18, 2016.

What We Need & What You Get

Our total costs for participating in this performance is $1200. Here is how the expenses are being broken down:

  • Rehearsal Costs: $300. This equates to  20 hours of rehearsal space. 
  • Dancer Fees: $800. This will cover a large percentage of the fees we are paying our dancers for their performance at the show. We have some funding already set aside for this, however we still have a little ways to go. Your contribution will help a dancer get paid for the cultural contribution they are making to NYC community.
  • Costume Costs: $100. This will cover the costs of costuming 11 dancers.

If we are unable to reach our funding goal the monies will be used to cover as many of these expenses as possible.

As a thank you for your generous contributions we will gift you:

  • $20 USD Collegiate Star: For all contributions of $20 or less you will receive a Thank You Shout Out on our social media platforms.
  • $25 USD Off Broadway Star: For all contributions of $25-$49.99 you will receive an autographed company photo and a Thank You Shout Out on our social media platforms.

  • $50 USD Broadway Star: For all contributions between $50-$99.99, you will receive a DVD of our November 12 performance, a video shout out on our social media platforms and all the perks in the lower levels. (Amount over $2.00 is tax-deductible.)

  • $100 USD All-Star: For all contributions of $100-$199.99 you will receive all of the lower level perks and an Aries In Flight T-Shirt. (Amount over $10 is tax-deductible.)

  • $200 USD Super Star: For all contributions of $200 or more you will a shout out thank you on our social media sites, a DVD of the performance, 1 ticket to the November 12 show (you may choose either 4pm or 7pm show), and a 1-Hour Meet and Greet/Performance with the company. Catherine will contact you privately to arrange a date. (Amount over $59 is tax deductible.)

The Impact

The success of this campaign will enable Aries In Flight to bring the legacy of theater jazz to a wider audience. Since our last fundraising campaign last year we have been selected to perform at 5 different venues and have grown our social media following by 20%. Additionally our company has begun to offer workshops to aid dancers in creating long and sustainable dance careers. Aries In Flight is emerging as leader in the dance industry and your support will enable us to continue to grow and share our mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute at this time, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues who would be interested in this project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share buttons to post directly on your social media sites about this campaign.

Any support you can offer is greatly appreciated.

story:
En route vers la Chine

Soutenez la diffusion internationale du spectacle La cigale et la fourmi, qui sera présenté dans 13 villes chinoises du 13 juillet au 23 août 2016. Il s’agit de la troisième tournée en Chine pour la compagnie de danse Sursaut, qui agit à titre d’ambassadrice pour la création d’ici diffusée à l’étranger. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour la réussite de cette expédition de six semaines dans l’Empire du Milieu !


Adoptez une ville !

En participant à notre campagne de sociofinancement, nous vous offrons la chance de parrainer l’une des 13 villes chinoises où le spectacle sera présenté. Adoptez la ville de votre choix et choisissez le montant de votre don pour avoir droit à nos contreparties originales !

Pour ce faire, écrivez-nous dans l'onglet "Commentaires" (en haut de la page) le nom de la destination que vous souhaitez adopter. Surveillez notre page Facebook pour connaitre chaque jour la cité à l'honneur !

Le spectacle

La cigale et la fourmi est une œuvre chorégraphique pour les petits et les grands qui pose un regard sur le monde de l’art et de l’agriculture. Librement inspirée de la célèbre fable de Jean de La Fontaine, cette œuvre nous transporte au cœur de la vie, dans le difficile et le beau de l’ordinaire. Des semailles à la moisson, le spectacle propose une vision bucolique sans naïveté du monde de l’artiste et du paysan.

Œuvre d’envergure pour sept danseurs, La cigale et la fourmi témoigne de la maturité de la démarche artistique de la chorégraphe Francine Châteauvert, récipiendaire du Prix du CALQ-Œuvre de l’année en Estrie 2014.

Sera également présentée en première partie du spectacle une version revisitée d'Étude verticale, chorégraphie tirée du spectacle Boo! 


La compagnie de danse Sursaut

La compagnie de danse Sursaut se consacre à la création, à la production et à la diffusion de spectacles de danse pour la jeunesse et la famille. Joyeuses, poétiques et touchantes, les œuvres chorégraphiques de la compagnie témoignent de la maturité d’une démarche artistique évolutive, axée depuis trente ans vers le jeune public. Connaissant l’exigence, l’intelligence, la grande ouverture et la capacité d’écoute des enfants, la compagnie travaille avec sérieux, authenticité et avec le plus grand respect pour ce public. Présentées d’un océan à l’autre au Canada et à l’étranger, les créations de Sursaut inspirent et ravissent à la fois les jeunes et les moins jeunes.

La compagnie de danse Sursaut fait figure de pionnière au Canada en danse contemporaine pour la jeunesse et la famille et contribue au développement de la danse professionnelle en dehors des grands centres urbains. Convaincue de l’importance de l’art destiné aux jeunes, la compagnie poursuit son mandat et travaille à rendre la danse accessible à tous.


Notre équipe

Ce n’est pas moins de dix personnes de la compagnie qui s’envoleront pour la Chine cet été. D’abord les sept interprètes du spectacle, Stéphanie Brochard, Amandine Garrido Gonzalez, Jasmine Inns, Geneviève Lauzon, Keven Lee, Elise Legrand et Xavier Malo, ainsi que Simon Vincent, technicien, Armando Gomez Rubio, directeur technique, et Adam Dymburt, directeur de tournée. Ils seront accompagnés sur place par trois représentants de l’agence Beijing Eurovista Arts Promotion, qui nous accueille pour la tournée, et qui serviront d’interprètes à notre équipe tout au long de leur séjour.

Financement

La compagnie est subventionnée par le Conseil des arts du Canada et le Conseil des arts et des lettres du Québec pour la réalisation de ses tournées internationales, mais ce financement ne comble pas tous les frais reliés à une tournée de cette envergure. 

Tous les fonds amassés dans le cadre de cette campagne de sociofinancement seront dédiés à la tournée du spectacle La cigale et la fourmi en Chine, afin d’assurer son succès.


Comment contribuer?

Participez financièrement via Indiegogo en choisissant la contrepartie qui vous inspire à droite de la page. Peu importe le montant, toutes les contributions sont précieuses !!!

*Vous préférez un envoi par chèque ou en argent? Acheminez le montant ainsi que votre choix de contrepartie à l’adresse suivante:

Compagnie de danse Sursaut
250, rue du Dépôt, bureau 322
Sherbrooke (Québec)
J1H 5G1

Ceux qui ne désirent pas recevoir de contrepartie recevront par la poste un reçu pour fin d'impôts au montant de leur don.

Aidez-nous à réaliser ce projet d'envergure!

Merci de faire circuler le lien de cette page dans vos réseaux. 

Chaque clic contribue au positionnement stratégique de la campagne. Nous vous encourageons donc à nous aider en partageant ce lien!

Suivez-nous sur Facebook pour connaître les développements du projet : 

https://www.facebook.com/CompagniededanseSursaut/

À tous et toutes, un immense merci pour votre appui!

capacité d’écoute des enfants, la compagnie travaille avec sérieux,

océan à l’autre au Canada et à l’étranger, les créations de Sursaut inspirent
et ravissent à la fois les jeunes et les moins jeunes.
La compagnie de danse
Sursaut fait figure de pionnière au Canada en danse contemporaine pour la
jeunesse et la famille et contribue au développement de la danse
professionnelle en dehors des grands centres urbains. Convaincue de
l’importance de l’art destiné aux jeunes, la compagnie poursuit son mandat et
travaille à rendre la danse accessible à tous.











Notre équipe


Ce n’est pas moins de
dix personnes de la compagnie qui s’envoleront pour la Chine cet été. D’abord
les sept interprètes du spectacle, Stéphanie Brochard, Amandine Garrido
Gonzalez, Jasmine Inns, Geneviève Lauzon, Keven Lee, Elise Legrand et Xavier
Malo, ainsi que Simon Vincent, technicien, Armando Gomez Rubio, directeur
technique, et Adam Dymburt, directeur de tournée. Ils seront accompagnés sur
place par trois représentants de l’agence Beijing Eurovista Arts Promotion, qui nous accueille pour la
tournée, et qui serviront d’interprètes à notre équipe tout au long de leur séjour.

Financement

La compagnie est subventionnée par
le Conseil des arts du Canada et le Conseil des arts et des lettres du Québec
pour la réalisation de ses tournées internationales, mais ce financement ne comble pas tous les frais reliés à une tournée de cette envergure. 
Tous les fonds amassés dans le cadre de cette campagne de
sociofinancement seront dédiés à la tournée du spectacle La cigale et la fourmi en Chine, afin d’assurer son succès.






Comment contribuer?
 
Participez financièrement via Indiegogo en choisissant la contrepartie qui vous inspire à droite de la page. Peu importe le montant, toutes les contributions sont précieuses !!!

*Vous préférez un envoi par chèque ou en argent? Acheminez le montant ainsi que votre choix de contrepartie à l’adresse suivante:
Compagnie de danse Sursaut250, rue du Dépôt, bureau 322Sherbrooke (Québec)J1H 5G1
Ceux qui ne désirent pas recevoir de contrepartie recevront par la poste un reçu pour fin d'impôts au montant de leur don.
Aidez-nous à réaliser ce projet d'envergure!

Merci de faire circuler le lien de cette page dans vos réseaux. 
Chaque clic contribue au positionnement stratégique de la campagne. Nous vous encourageons donc à nous aider en partageant ce lien!Suivez-nous sur Facebook pour connaître les développements du projet : https://www.facebook.com/CompagniededanseSursaut/   
À tous et toutes, un immense merci pour
votre appui!

story:
Short Summary

Life Is A Dream Tour began in 2015 in New York City under the direction of experimental director Lauren Hlubny (This is Not A Table for Three; re:Memory), and now involves an all-female cast from Jersey City, San Francisco, Boston, Seattle, New Orleans, NYC, Portland (Maine), and Paris. 

Life Is A Dream Paris is mime. Is puppetry. Is dance. Is opera. Is theatre. It blurs the distinction between dream and reality, between nightmare and beauty, and between the subconscious and the conscious. Utilizing a curated and cut version of Calderon’s work, the company of Life Is A Dream Tour discovers new and innovative ways to access the text and tell the 17th Century tale while discovering new stories and relevancy.

Life Is A Dream Tour  has been performed in July 2015 in Kent Park, Brooklyn (a beach facing Manhattan) during sunset, and in October 2015 in Portland Pleasant Oaks Amphitheatre (a neighborhood backyard) with a fire pit and 30-foot-tall-shadows from sunset into the evening.  Next stop, with your support, will be Paris!


What We Need 

The performers are coming from both the US and France, so we're asking just enough to cover plane tickets and transportation funds. If anything is left over, it will go towards hostels, props, and costumes. 

The Show 

With beautiful Spanish Golden Age text, sex, wit, and artistry, we invite the audience on Segismundo’s journey of questioning what is real versus dreaming, what is honor versus complacency, what is man versus woman, what is love versus imagination, and how none of these are perhaps opposites at all. 

The tale is of Segismundo, a prisoner who wakes up one morning to find that he has been crowned king, to arise the next morning in jail, only to later become king again, as he was a prince the whole time. 


Why Paris?

Life Is A Dream Tour has been performed in two locations with completely different objectives, performers, environments, and dreams. The production we are working on for Paris would be special to Paris and Paris alone. We are currently working with Paris-based performers and US-based performers, will work with any site that you give us. 

 With Paris at heart, Life Is A Dream Paris is a Surrealist performance piece.  A theatrical mindfuck, Life Is A Dream Paris is a macabre question of whether or not you are awake. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Like the Life is a Dream Tour Facebook page and take this journey with us. 
  • Share this Campaign using #LIADParis and spread the word!

story:
The legendary playwright Noël Coward wrote Home Chat in 1927 when it was first performed. Its groundbreaking portrayal of a woman unconstrained by conservative societal norms went down sourly with the original audience, nearly relegating the play to obscurity for almost nine decades.

The playtext was discovered last year by our director, Martin Parr, who obtained the rights from the Noël Coward estate to stage the play, and the Finborough Theatre offered its space for the revival to take place.

Now, we are turning to the public to help mount this momentous revival. All donations will go towards the costs of staging a professional theatrical production including physical costs, marketing and venue hire. In addition, through a deal with publishers, the playscript will be available to the public, and Home Chat will be appreciated for the masterpiece it is.

Following a disastrous train crash in Paris, during which Janet Ebony and her best friend Peter Chelsworth are sharing a sleeping compartment, scandalous outrage ensues as Janet's husband Paul and her fearsome mother-in-law accuse them of adultery and public indiscretion.

Matters are made worse when Janet's equally fearsome mother and Peter's fiancée, Lavinia Hardy, enter the maelstrom. Confusion, accusation and outrage are the order of the day as Janet and Peter, aghast at their families disapproval, plot to invent an adulterous affair, to test the limits of their warring kin.

As the play reaches its climax, everybody’s world is turned on its head as, after a series of devilish twists, the true deceivers are revealed and Janet steps into a new and surprising future...

In order to break even for a play of this size, with a theatre the size of the Finborough Theatre, we must raise at least £18,000 in grants and donations before ticket sales. As of June, we have raised upwards of £8,000 of that figure in personal gifts and donations. The remainder is down to people like you.

All the money raised will go towards costs of mounting the production (set, costume, lighting equipment). We aim to pay everyone a living wage for the weeks worked, and everyone involved is extremely dedicated and committed to the project. 

In return, we'd love for more people to be involved in the production process through regular updates from the production team and the cast. We can also offer tickets, as well as exclusive tickets to the press night, normally closed to anyone not in the industry. Finally, we can also offer the opportunity to watch the dress rehearsal, giving you the opportunity to not only see the show before anyone else, but also to see how the workings of a professional theatre company function!

This is an extremely significant play. Written the year before women won the vote in the UK, its portrayal of a woman bound by societal norms is of great historical significance, and its echoes are equally relevant today. Our aim is to bring these themes and depictions to light through a series of student workshops led by our director in order to engage a younger audience with what may seem distant from their own experiences.

In addition, through a deal with specialist theatre publishers, we will be able to make the playscript widely available for the first time in history. The playscript also contains the programme, meaning the production will go down in history along with the story of Home Chat.

story:
Ransack Theatre are developing their new play, Enveloped in Velvet, into an intimate, site-specific production to be premièred in a railway tunnel for Flow Salford.

We are Ransack Theatre. Hello and thank you for taking the time to look at this page!

Developing and producing plays in non-theatre spaces is an exciting and difficult task. Enveloped in Velvet is not being staged in a conventional theatre, where there are established support systems, so we need your help more than ever !!

- - - 

WHO WE ARE

Ransack Theatre is an award-winning Salford based theatre company established in 2013 by graduates from the University of Manchester.

We often work in unconventional settings to produce politically engaged theatre that strives to make the audience active during the performance.


                                                            

You can follow us on Twitter here or find us on Facebook here. 

THE PLAY

Enveloped in Velvet explores the way in which people communicate, feel and empathise; tackling the peculiarly modern struggle between how we are socially conditioned to feel and how we actually feel.

Four people find themselves stranded in the shallow waters of modern existence. Facing up to the self-deception and triviality of their everyday encounters, each challenge themselves to speak honestly about the things we think but don't say. As the four monologues veer in different directions, they eventually collide in an event that unites them all.


WRITER Piers Black-Hawkins

DIRECTOR Cat Robey

PRODUCER Alastair Michael

ASSOCIATE PRODUCER Charlotte Mountford

SET DESIGNER Irene Jade

SOUND DESIGNER Mark Harris

STAGE MANAGER Cerys Spilsbury 

CAST Beth Holmes

             Kenneth Jay

             Ali Michael

             James Warburton


                         

                       

Enveloped in Velvet is an in-house piece of new writing from emerging playwright, Piers Black-Hawkins. It has been in development for 18 months having begun life in our scratch night. The piece then went through further development with the backing and support of HomeMCR. An invited audience of industry professionals attended two showings of the work at HomeMCR, both of which were followed with a Q&A session aimed at taking on board their thoughts and criticisms, so that we could continue to develop the show. 

Flow Salford is an opportunity for our development work with this show to continue and finally come to fruition. 


WHY IS THE SHOW RELEVANT?

In all of human history, there has never been so many people on the earth and we have never been able to connect with each other so easily. As technologies progress, we are becoming ever more connected in the way that we can communicate.

Despite this, people's ability to empathise with one another is beginning to falter. And this is no surprise. The way we interact is changing; we have fewer face-to-face conversations with our friends. We have to work harder to engage emotionally, working against apathy, distraction and selfishness. Ironically, although we are better connected, we are increasingly socially isolated.

We feel that the best way to explore the issues in this play is by creating an intimate show outside of a 'theatre' where people are invited to be together in the same physical environment and engage in their own self-examination.


THE FESTIVAL

Ransack Theatre's Enveloped in Velvet is a sponsored project of Flow Salford, which is supported by the BBC Performing Arts Fund.


                                   


Flow Salford is a weekend festival celebrating the vast, the varied and the very new theatre being made in Salford today. Supported by The Lowry, the festival is in its second year and is produced by the amazing Charlotte Mountford.


YOUR HELP

We are not relying on crowd-funding to cover the total cost of our production. We have been very fortunate with the kind of support we have received from local artists and companies, for example rehearsal space has been offered by The Lowry and venue hire has been covered by the festival. 
This has meant that we have been able to trim the budget substantially. 

However, with your help we still need to raise £600 to cover the following costs:

Set design and construction £400
The environment of this show is very important. We are hiring a designer to help get the best out of the unconventional space that we are using for the performances. This fee is for the design, materials and any construction/dressing.

                                   


Sound design £200
We have worked with a fantastic local sound designer (Mark Harris, pictured below) on many previous projects. We are hoping to work with him again for this show as a subtly crafted sound scape will be vitally important in establishing a specific atmosphere for the production. As we are not in a theatre space, we will also require our sound designer to be the technical operator for the show, which is a fairly big responsibility.

                                



Thank you! 


If you’ve read this far, we’re already very grateful. There are lots of projects needing your support around this time of year, so anything you can spare to help us will be greatly appreciated. 

And if you can’t contribute but would still like to help, spread the word by sharing this page with anyone who you think might be interested.

And, of course, come along and watch the show this September in Salford - for more details on the festival and where to get tickets click here!

story:
About The Show

With four dancers 'Wags Alternate' investigates the undercurrents and impulses of caricature, alter-ego, and the hidden aspects of our lives. 

What do we choose to display to the world? Our lives are essentially our own theatrical production with the individual as the leading actor, fabricating how to curate the daily show. 

Set in a forest of red ropes and lightbulbs, this dance piece is visually tantalizing. It is a result of long-standing collaboration between choreographer Thoenn Glover, lighting designer Rob Sondergaard, and sound designer Mac Hunter. 

With a passionate creative team behind it dedicated to the development and completion of the work since it's conception,  it is ready to hit the stage! Wags Alternate will premiere at the Dancing on the Edge Festival, co-presented by the Dance Centre in Vancouver BC this July. 

How You Can Help

We are looking to raise $5000 to help this show reach it's full potential and bring the work to audiences this July 2016. Funds will go towards:

  • Paying the artists
  • Lighting equipment rental
  • Costuming and props
  • Marketing and promotion
By becoming a backer, not only are you showing your support to the project but also to the Vancouver dance community.  Any amount helps, and to thank you for your support we offer a variety of perks from dance prints, to your very own personalized choreography, and much more! Even if we don't reach our funding goal we still get to keep what we raise, so every penny will go directly towards our costs.

About The Choreographer

Since 2009, Thoenn Glover has building a career as a Vancouver-based choreographer, dancer and teacher. Growing up in a remote community in Northern British Columbia she brings a unique perspective to her art form.  Her background of living off the grid with limited pop-culture influences has given her an instinctual and visceral approach to her work, and a ‘DIY/anything’s possible’ attitude towards the art form. 

In her choreography Thoenn bridges the aesthetics of cinema and contemporary dance. She uses vivid characters, fragments of narratives, bold lighting design, and shifting sound scores to create cutting edge works that appeal to not only art enthusiasts but also to those who don’t normally take in contemporary dance.

Her choreography has been presented at festivals and series across Canada and she has been recognized as an innovative young artist.

Spread The Word

If you can't donate you can help by liking the Facebook page, and spreading the word to those who can. Every bit of publicity helps! 

THANK YOU!

story:
Youth Theatre for the Heart

SVC Theatre is a non-profit 501(c)3 community theatre serving the South Valley of Las Vegas and Henderson in Clark County, Nevada. The mission of SVC Theatre is to enrich through the community by providing a variety of productions of different genres for community members to participate in as performers, production partners, or audience members and to provide a youth program that affords sequential educational opportunities to individuals of all social and economic backgrounds.

SVC Theatre is hosting a youth driven theatre project. Youth volunteers will research and develop, write and stage a play to benefit women'sheart initiatives for the Las Vegas Chapter of the American Heart Association. Eighty percent of ticket sales, a potential of $12,768 earnings, will benefit the Las Vegas Chapter of the American Heart Association.

Break Down 0f Costs

We will need $2500 to get this project off the ground. The breakdown of the cost is as follows.

  • $200-Materials(20ea x 10 participants)
  • $40- Final Presentation to Board of Directors(meeting space fee)
  • $60-Final Presentaion Materials(packets for board members, epuipment needed, etc.)
  • $100-Field Trips/Team Building- Students will participate in several team building activities including volunteering at events that support their writing efforts.
  • $2000- Guest Artist Fee- Students will work with a seasoned playwright who will guide them through the process from start to finish.
  • $100- Misc. Supplies
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by spreading the word about the campaign. Use all your media outlets such as facebook and twitter and tell your friends about it. Thank you for all your support. Every penny counts so please donate.

SVC Theatre is hosting a youth driven theatre project. Youth volunteers will research and develop, write and stage a play to benefit women'sheart initiatives for the Las Vegas Chapter of the American Heart Association. Eighty percent of ticket sales, a potential of $12,768 earnings, will benefit the Las Vegas Chapter of the American Heart Association.


Break Down 0f Costs
We will need $2500 to get this project off the ground. The breakdown of the cost is as follows.

$200-Materials(20ea x 10 participants)
$40- Final Presentation to Board of Directors(meeting space fee)
$60-Final Presentaion Materials(packets for board members, epuipment needed, etc.)
$100-Field Trips/Team Building- Students will participate in several team building activities including volunteering at events that support their writing efforts.
$2000- Guest Artist Fee- Students will work with a seasoned playwright who will guide them through the process from start to finish.
$100- Misc. Supplies


 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help by spreading the word about the campaign. Use all your media outlets such as facebook and twitter and tell your friends about it. Thank you for all your support. Every penny counts so please donate.
campaign_city: Las Vegas and Henderson, United States

story:
Your generous support will help Schweinehund become a full-length theatre piece.

Schweinehund is a puppetry and animation piece created and directed by me, Andy Gaukel.

Inspired by the life of Pierre Seel— who was arrested by the Gestapo and imprisoned by the Nazis in 1941 on suspicion of being gay— Schweinehund is a meditation on Seel’s real-life tragedy during this dark time.

Funds generated by the generous Indiegogo community will be used to help fund the final phase of Schweinehund's development. This phase includes rehearsing the piece and preparing it to be premiered in front of a live audience with the aim of touring Schweinehund to theatres, schools, universities and festivals around the world. 

Your donation will: 

Pay for a rehearsal/workshop space this summer in Louisville, KY.

Help compensate my dedicated team of talented performers and artists involved.

Pay for a video projector for projecting Schweinehund’s animations.

Pay for the sound equipment.

Pay for the lighting equipment needed to light the puppetry.

Pay for media materials such as posters, photos and advertising to help further promote Schweinehund.

Any funds received past our goal will go towards bringing Schweinehund to a wider audience.

Schweinehund History, Techniques and Hopes:

Initially developed as a ten-minute workshop performance for the 2011 Xperimental Puppetry Theater Program at the Center for Puppetry Arts in Atlanta, GA, myself and my team are now focused on developing Schweinehund into a full-length puppet theater production that will premiere in 2014. 

To tell this delicate story, I have decided to use Bunraku inspired puppet manipulation combined with projected hand-drawn animations to create an integrated choreographed movement piece set to music.

To create the animation in Schweinehund, I am collaborating with Michael Collin, an artist based in Glasgow, Scotland. Michael's animations create the perfect juxtaposition to the bleak world and devastating story the puppetry tells.

What started as a pursuit to bring one man’s tragic story to life, has evolved into a gripping and deeply personal meditation on the depths of cruelty and the resilience of the human spirit.

My team and I hope to share this amazing and touching story in hope that it will increase understanding and create a dialogue among the generations of today that will positively impact the future.

Biggest Challenge:

It's no secret, the biggest challenge in producing live theatre is financing. Even with my team of incredible artists, all the talent in the world won't provide the necessary equipment and means needed to fulfill our vision.

Without you, this kind of theatre cannot exist. 

Thank you so much for your support,

Andy Gaukel

www.andygaukel.com

Nice Things People Have Written About Schweiehund:

“This love story, that spans decades, gives us what we all want GREAT PUPPET THEATRE.” – Peter Allen, Puppetry Journal

“Schweinehund was a beautifully told and technically innovative story mixing animation and puppetry seamlessly; the audience was amazed”. – secretusherman.wordpress.com

Please click on the gallery above to view more of photos Schweinehund 

OTHER WAYS TO PROPELL US INTO MOTION...

SHARE our campaign on your FACEBOOK and/or TWITTER pages.

ENCOURAGE your friends to make a contribution.

SPREAD the word, tell everyone and anyone you know.

REACH OUT by email to any individuals and/or companies whom you think might be interested in sponsoring us, ask anyone you think might be interested in supporting this amazing and touching story.
